intro: Grevillea stenogyne, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Grevillea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and striking red or orange flowers that appear in spikes. The plant is part of the Proteaceae family, which includes many species with showy inflorescences. Grevillea stenogyne typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
